channel.title: Docs on reno
channel.description: Recent content in Docs on reno

item.title: Installation
item.description: Binary packages You can download the latest binary package from here or from the GitHub release page. Linux (x64) 1.) Download the latest version: reno-linux-x64.zip 2.) Run it: ./reno Generic (Java) 1.) Download the latest version: reno-0.3.0.jar 2.) Run it: java -jar reno-0.3.0.jar The --pdf-backend pdfbox flag gives better results, but doesn’t work with native-image (see PDFBOX-4548). So if you would use the PDFBox backend, use the “Generic (Java)” version.

item.title: Usage
item.description: Usage main‚ü© reno --help Usage: reno export reno update reno dump reading notes extractor Options and flags: --help Display this help text. --version, -v Print the version number and exit. Subcommands: export Export the annotations from the given Pdf update update the notes in the Org-file with new annotations from the Pdf dump for debugging / inspection (run without arguments for the usage) Export annotations to an org-file Use the export subcommand to export your annotations.

item.title: Example
item.description: Reading notes I use reno to create reading notes. From this marked PDF Document: i get (after some edits) this org-mode snippet: where i can change some quotes to headers edit exported text add some notes for me Play with source code I can mark some challenges: and pack the source code in #+begin_src and #+end_src blocks to evaluate it with org-babel.

item.title: Contact / Support
item.description: Contact Check my GitHub Profile for my mail address. Send me an direct message on twitter. Use keybase to contact me. Support If you have any questions, trouble or other input, feel free to contact me directly (see Contact) or open a issue@github.
